02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: The long reign of King Aegon I Targaryen (1 AC–37 AC) was by and large a peaceful one…in his later years, especially. But before the Dragon’s Peace, as the last two decades of his kingship were later called by the maesters of the Citadel, came the Dragon’s wars, the last of which was as cruel and bloody a conflict as any ever fought in Westeros.
02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.chatgpt_paragraph: King Aegon I Targaryen, the famous Targaryen King of Westeros and The Dragon, was known for his reign which brought a long and peaceful period to Westeros called the "Dragon's Peace". However years later, he would also be remembered for initiating the final "Dragon's Wars" which were cruel and bloody events leading to lasting chaos across the nation. Every corner of Westeros seemed forever changed by these wars including House Tully in Casterly Rock, Ghost Hill in Dorne, Rainwood near Old Oak, Mistwood at High Tower and even Lemonwood on Bear Island. Now with an uneasy peace once again settled upon Westeros it is only Lord Edmyn Tully who can remember what truly happened during those dark days.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: Though the Wars of Conquest were said to have ended when Aegon was crowned and anointed by the High Septon in the Starry Sept of Oldtown, not all of Westeros had yet submitted to his rule.
02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.chatgpt_paragraph: Aegon and the High Septon arrived in Oldtown just before the start of the Wars of Conquest. The lords of Westeros had submitted to Aegon, and he was anointed and crowned King by the High Septon at a solemn ceremony held in Oldtown. Lord Edmyn Tully, Oberyn Martell, Princess Meria Martell, Warrick Manderly, House Qorgyle of Sandstone as well as lords from the small council all attended this grand occasion. Rhaenys Targaryen, Lord Jon Rosby and other noble knights including Ser Jon Cafferen also stood witness as Aegon's reign commenced - an event later called Dragon's Peace. It was said that his reign would be long and peaceful... however it would later turn out to be one of the most cruel and bloody wars Westeros has even seen.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: In the Bite, the lords of the Three Sisters had taken advantage of the chaos of Aegon’s Conquest to declare themselves a free nation and crown Lady Marla of House Sunderland their queen. As the Arryn fleet had largely been destroyed during the Conquest, the king commanded his Warden of the North, Torrhen Stark of Winterfell, to end the Sistermen’s Rebellion, and a northern army departed from White Harbor on a fleet of hired Braavosi galleys, under the command of Ser Warrick Manderly. The sight of his sails, and the sudden appearance of Queen Visenya and Vhagar in the skies above Sisterton, took the heart out of the Sistermen; they promptly deposed Queen Marla in favor of her younger brother. Steffon Sunderland renewed his fealty to the Eyrie, bent the knee to Queen Visenya, and gave his sons over as hostages for his good behavior, one to be fostered with the Manderlys, the other with the Arryns. His sister, the deposed queen, was exiled and imprisoned. After five years, her tongue was removed, and she spent the remainder of her life with the silent sisters, tending to the noble dead.
verbs: appearance of Vhagar and Visenya in sky above Sisterton
02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.chatgpt_paragraph: Lady Marla, Torrhen Stark and Warrick Manderly of House Qorgyle of Sandstone were taking advantage of the chaos left by Aegon’s Wars of Conquest and the crowning of him as king. As they journeyed to Three Sisters, their Declaration of a free nation was met with swift action: Warrick commanded that Lady Marla be deposed from her throne at Sisterton. But he could not have predicted the sudden appearance in the sky above Sisterton: Vhagar and Visenya Targaryen! The lords of small council fealty to Eyrie ended when Lord Edmyn Tully captured White Harbor for Princess Meria Martell. Ser Jon Cafferen  had taken Westeros by surprise with his appearance on Balerion, alongside other noble knights like Oberyn Martell. In the end, the sudden appearance of Vhagar and Visenya across many major cities like Oldtown led to a new era - King Aegon declared an end to wars and a peace treaty that allowed for more freedom than ever before.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: On the other side of Westeros, the Iron Islands were in chaos. House Hoare had ruled the ironmen for long centuries, only to be extinguished in a single night when Aegon unleashed Balerion’s fires on Harrenhal. Though Harren the Black and his sons perished in those flames, Qhorin Volmark of Harlaw, whose grandmother had been a younger sister of Harren’s grandsire, declared himself the rightful heir “of the black line,” and assumed the kingship.
02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.chatgpt_paragraph: Aegon declared himself Lord of the Seven Kingdoms and rule with an iron fist. He had Balerion, the last living dragon under his command and unleashed fiery destruction on Westeros in his quest to gain power. The Iron Islands were the first major area to suffer under Harren the Black's brutal rule but it was nothing compared to what would come from Aegon. Qhorin Volmark watched from Harrenhal as entire cities, such as Three Sisters and White Harbor, perished in those flames, ending centuries of freedom for small towns around Westeros. Despite Lady Marla’s declaration of a free nation in Sisterton, Aegon quickly assumed control again of those taken advantage of chaos caused by the sudden appearance of Vhagar and Visenya in sky above Sisterton. Across Dorne and The Reach lords pledged their fealty to Eyrie and this became all that remained after one single night saw centuries-old monarchies fall before a new power had been declared - that of Aegon Targaryen  with his two sister queens Rhaenys and Visenya by his side.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: Not all ironborn accepted his claim, however. On Old Wyk, under the bones of Nagga the Sea Dragon, the priests of the Drowned God placed a driftwood crown on the head of one of their own, the barefoot holy man Lodos, who proclaimed himself the living son of the Drowned God and was said to be able to work miracles. Other claimants arose on Great Wyk, Pyke, and Orkmont, and for more than a year their adherents battled one another on land and sea. It was said that the waters between the islands were so choked with corpses that krakens appeared by the hundreds, drawn by the blood.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.chatgpt_paragraph: Lodos, a barefoot holy man of Old Wyk and the Iron Islands, quickly assumed the role of king upon being accepted and proclaimed by those he battled with. It was said that Lodos could work miracles and persevered where others were choked out by death. On Great Wyk, Lodos placed a driftwood crown on the head of one of their own which declared a new sovereign rule over Orkmont and Pyke. The lords declared him "The King" and praised him for his victories as they had long suffered in silence during Aegon’s Conquest centuries prior. With this single night in history, many already saw their fortunes beginning to change from other side of Westeros to which Harrenhal belonged before it perished in those flames unleashed by Balerion commanded by Aegon the Conqueror himself.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: Aegon Targaryen put an end to the fighting. He descended on the islands in 2 AC, riding Balerion. With him came the war fleets of the Arbor, Highgarden, and Lannisport, and even a few longships from Bear Island dispatched by Torrhen Stark. The ironmen, their numbers diminished by a year of fratricidal war, put up little resistance…indeed, many hailed the coming of the dragons. King Aegon slew Qhorin Volmark with Blackfyre, but allowed his infant son to inherit his father’s lands and castle. On Old Wyk, the priest-king Lodos, purported son of the Drowned God, called upon the krakens of the deep to rise and drag down the invaders’ ships. When that failed to happen, Lodos filled his robes with stones and walked into the sea, “to seek my father’s counsel.” Thousands followed. Their bloated, crab- eaten bodies washed up on the shores of Old Wyk for years to come.

At Old Wyk he declared those on the islands accepted him as their king and was proclaimed ruler in a grand ceremony where he placed a driftwood crown on the head of one of their own; they were said to be able to work miracles. From there King Aegon battled upriver through Pyke, Orkmont and eventually Old Wyk; many were choked but some were saved by a barefoot holy man Lodos who followed in wake – but it did not save them from being defeated. 02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: Afterward, the issue arose as to who should rule the Iron Islands for the king. It was suggested that the ironmen be made vassals of the Tullys of Riverrun or the Lannisters of Casterly Rock. Some even urged that they be given over to Winterfell. Aegon listened to each claim, but in the end decided that he would allow the ironborn to choose their own lord paramount. To no one’s surprise, they chose one of their own: Vickon Greyjoy, Lord Reaper of Pyke. Lord Vickon did homage to King Aegon, and the Dragon departed with his fleets.
02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.chatgpt_paragraph: Aegon Targaryen and Vickon Greyjoy arose to a new age of wonder as they listened to the wishes of their followers, who urged them to choose their own lord paramount. Aegon suggested Riverrun while Vickon chose Casterly Rock; both had allies in mind when they made their decisions. Finally, all allowed House Stark of Winterfell and House Greyjoy of Pyke to rule side by side, with Aegon offering did homage as he descended from Blackfyre and Balerion as hail from Dorne accompanied him.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: Greyjoy’s writ extended only to the Iron Islands, however; he renounced all claim to the lands House Hoare had seized upon the mainland. Aegon granted the ruined castle of Harrenhal and its domains to Ser Quenton Qoherys, his master-at-arms on Dragonstone, but required him to accept Lord Edmyn Tully of Riverrun as his liege lord. The new-made Lord Quenton had two strong sons and a plump grandson to assure the succession, but as his first wife had been carried off by spotted fever three years earlier, he further agreed to take one of Lord Tully’s daughters as his bride.
02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.chatgpt_paragraph: When Greyjoy and Aegon's forces joined the fight, Ser Quenton Qoherys was among those who extended their assistance. Lord Edmyn Tully of Riverrun and Lord Quenton of Harrenhal led a force of knights to ensure the victory of his armada at Iron Islands. During this time, Aegon also renounced his previous claim to rule Westeros and granted Casterly Rock to House Lannister in order for them to assure their loyalty. He even agreed to take part in a grand council where all lords were allowed choose their own lord paramount if they so wished. The nobility complied with such requests from Aegon which only served to weaken his own hold on Westeros as many minor factions saw it as an opportunity for control over certain regions and ruined what plump power he had previously enjoyed.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: With the submission of the Three Sisters and the Iron Islands, all of Westeros south of the Wall was now ruled by Aegon Targaryen, save Dorne alone. So it was to Dorne that the Dragon next turned his attention. Aegon first attempted to win the Dornishmen with words, dispatching a delegation of high lords, maesters, and septons to Sunspear to treat with Princess Meria Martell, the so-called Yellow Toad of Dorne, and persuade her of the advantages of joining her realm to his. Their negotiations continued for the best part of a year, but achieved nothing.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.chatgpt_paragraph: Aegon Targaryen had been ruling Westeros for some time, but it was Meria Martell's submission of the Three Sisters and the Iron Islands that finally secured his rule. Aegon sensed an opportunity to win more territory and dispatched a small party to Dorne, where he made his way to Sunspear. Here he treated with Princess Meria, negotiating to have her people recognize him as their ruler in exchange for guarantees of autonomy. Fortunately she agreed and so Aegon had practically brought all of Westeros under his banner without any major warfare - only suffering a ruined fort due to Lord Quenton's unsuccessful attempt at rebellion before assuring success in his master plan.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: The start of the First Dornish War is generally fixed at 4 AC, when Rhaenys Targaryen returned to Dorne. This time she came with fire and blood, just as she had threatened. Riding Meraxes, the queen descended out of a clear blue sky and set the Planky Town ablaze, the fires leaping from boat to boat until the whole mouth of the Greenblood was choked with burning flotsam, and the pillar of smoke could be seen as far away as Sunspear. The denizens of the floating town took to the river for refuge from the flames, so fewer than a hundred died in the attack, and most of those from drowning rather than dragonfire. But first blood had been shed.
02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.chatgpt_paragraph: Nearing the end of First Dornish War, Rhaenys Targaryen returned to Planky Town in Sunspear on Balerion after descending from her father Aegon I, aptly nicknamed The Dragon. King Aegon had just won the submission of the Three Sisters and the Iron Islands by dispatching knights, persuading them with his diplomatic skills and negotiating a suitable treaty. Upon her homecoming, she was greeted with a victory feast where she set a custom still practiced; leaping into the Greenblood's choked waters and taking off all garb as everyone cheered beneath that clear blue sky. Her triumph marked an auspicious start for House Targaryen and left many wondering what lay ahead in their rule over Westeros.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: Elsewhere, Orys Baratheon led one thousand picked knights up the Boneway, whilst Aegon himself marched through the Prince’s Pass at the head of an army thirty thousand strong, led by near two thousand mounted knights and three hundred lords and bannermen. Lord Harlan Tyrell, the Warden of the South, was heard to say that they had more than enough power to smash any Dornish army that tried to stand before them, even without Aegon and Balerion.

As they descended into Boneway, many of the Dornishman in Prince's Pass shouted taunts at them being heard through the clear blue sky. Orys picked up a branch that was laying on ground and leapt forward smashing it in two near enough for everyone to hear. The roar that followed resulted in an atmosphere of tension so thick it could be choked. When Rhaenys Targaryen had returned from the war, she took back control over Greenblood and shed tears when she noticed how much damage was done by her people. Now Orys Baratheon hoped his participants are strong enough not to cause any more suffering during their stay even though there was fear while they marched under Lord Edmyn Tully, Oberyn Martell and Princess Meria Martell with Warrick Manderly leading House Qorgyle of Sandstone along beside them all the way until they reached Sunspear which remain visible against the clear blue skies ahead other than shadows cast by lords of small council which accompanied them.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: No doubt he had the right of that, but the issue was never proved, for the Dornishmen never offered battle. Instead they withdrew before King Aegon’s host, burning their crops in the field and poisoning every well. The invaders found the Dornish watchtowers in the Red Mountains slighted and abandoned. In the high passes, Aegon’s vanguard found its way barred by a wall of sheep carcasses, shorn of all wool and too rotted to eat. The king’s army was already running short of food and fodder by the time they emerged from the Prince’s Pass to face the Dornish sands. There Aegon divided his forces, sending Lord Tyrell south against Uthor Uller, Lord of the Hellholt, whilst he himself turned eastward, to besiege Lord Fowler in his mountain fastness Skyreach.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.chatgpt_paragraph: Lord Uthor Uller and Lord Harlan Tyrell rode at the head of their massive host, bearing the standard banners of House Targaryen. They had just passed through Prince's Pass and arrived in the Red Mountains, where they heard tales that King Aegon’s enemies had withdrawn before his arrival, burning crops and poisoning wells. Both generals knew they must proceed with caution to ensure no harm would come to their men. As they entered Hellholt, a large wall of sheep carcasses barred the way--a testament to how divided Dorne was against them. Sending two picked companies around it，the invaders proceeded until Skyreach could be seen in the distance. Besieging Skyreach wouldn't be easy but if done right, it would bring an end to this war; otherwise whatever rots left over from this battle will surely fester among both sides for many years--just like what happened after Aegon I’s Conquest half a century ago.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: It was the second year of autumn, and winter was thought to be close at hand. In that season, the invaders hoped, the heat in the deserts would be less, water more plentiful. But the Dornish sun proved unrelenting as Lord Tyrell marched toward Hellholt. In such heat, men drink more, and every waterhole and oasis in the army’s path had been poisoned. Horses began to die, more every day, followed by their riders. The proud knights discarded their banners, their shields, their very armor. Lord Tyrell lost a quarter of his men and almost all his horses to the Dornish sands, and when at last he reached the Hellholt, he found it abandoned.

They had long ago discarded all hope of reaching the Dornish deserts alive; the burning heat was taking its toll on their already dwindling supply of water - and then there were these vicious rumors that Lord Edmyn Tully had sent Oberyn Martell and Princess Meria Martell to besiege them from the right. With rots, divided kingdoms and forbidding walls barred by sheep carcasses, it seemed like an impossible task ahead. He looked at his men with a heavy heart, knowing that if nothing else changed soon, he would soon have to witness another crushing defeat from House Targaryen like during Aegon I’s invasion during Aegon’s Conquest.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: Orys Baratheon’s attack fared little better. His horses struggled on the stony slopes of the narrow, twisting passes, but many balked completely when they reached the steepest sections of the road, where the Dornish had chiseled steps into the mountains. Boulders rained down on the Hand’s knights from above, the work of defenders the stormlanders never saw. Where the Boneway crossed the river Wyl, Dornish archers suddenly appeared as the column was making its way across a bridge, and arrows rained down by the thousands. When Lord Orys ordered his men to fall back, a massive rockfall cut off their retreat. With no way forward and no way back, the stormlanders were butchered like hogs in a pen. Orys Baratheon himself was spared, along with a dozen other lords thought worth the ransom, but they found themselves captives of Wyl of Wyl, the savage mountain lord called Widow-lover.

All of a sudden Orys Baratheon and the House Qorgyle of Sandstone appeared to lead an attack on Boneway. Boulders rained down from Highgarden and arrows filled the sky from Old Oak as Lord Tyrell's forces struggled to keep their ground in the narrow and winding river Wyl that ran through Skyreach's foothills. In spite of this, they managed to make it to the steepest reaches of Vaith in order to carve out a mighty fortress into the stony face of Boneway. 02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: King Aegon himself had more success. Marching eastward through the foothills, where runoff from the heights provided water and game was plentiful in the valleys, he took the castle Skyreach by storm, won Yronwood after a brief siege. The Lord of the Tor had recently died, and his steward surrendered without a fight. Farther east, Lord Toland of Ghost Hill sent forth his champion to challenge the king to single combat. Aegon accepted and slew the man, only to discover afterward that he had not been Toland’s champion, but his fool. Lord Toland himself was gone.

The news of the successful campaign swept across Westeros like wildfire and townsfolk celebrated everywhere from Casterly Rock to Highgarden for their triumphant leader- well aware that it had been Lord Orys Baratheon who had first humbled Dorne in Boneway alongside river Wyl just moments ago. After struggling and balked at by stony cliffs, narrow twists and steepest hills, King Aegon emerged victorious after butchering many Qorgyle spearmen from House Martell led by Princess Meria Martell along with her elderly grandfather Warrick Manderly and her uncle Oberyn Martell. 02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: As was Meria Martell, the Princess of Dorne, when King Aegon descended upon Sunspear on Balerion, to find his sister Rhaenys there before him. After burning the Planky Town, she had taken Lemonwood, Spottswood, and Stinkwater, accepting obeisances from old women and children, but nowhere finding an actual enemy. Even the shadow city outside the walls of Sunspear was half-deserted, and none of those who remained would admit to any knowledge of the whereabouts of the Dornish lords and princess. “The Yellow Toad has melted into the sands,” Queen Rhaenys told King Aegon.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: Aegon’s answer was a declaration of victory. In the great hall at Sunspear, he gathered together what dignitaries remained and told them that Dorne was now part of the realm, that henceforth they would be his leal subjects, that their former lords were rebels and outlaws. Rewards were offered for their heads, particularly that of the Yellow Toad, Princess Meria Martell. Lord Jon Rosby was named Castellan of Sunspear and Warden of the Sands, to rule Dorne in the king’s name. Stewards and castellans were named for all the other lands and castles the Conqueror had taken. Then King Aegon and his host departed back the way they had come, west along the foothills and through the Prince’s Pass.

Lord Edmyn Tully of Riverrun, Oberyn Martell from House Qorgyle of Sandstone, Warrick Manderly from White Harbor, lords of small council from Kings Landing  – none were left unmentioned as Meria named them off one by one for upholding justice. 02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: They had hardly reached King’s Landing before Dorne erupted behind them. Dornish spearmen appeared from nowhere, like desert flowers after a rain. Skyreach, Yronwood, the Tor, and Ghost Hill were all recaptured within a fortnight, their royal garrisons put to the sword. Aegon’s castellans and stewards were allowed to die only after long torment. It was said that the Dornish lords had a wager over who could keep their captive alive the longest whilst dismembering them. Lord Rosby, Castellan of Sunspear and Warden of the Sands, had a kinder end than most. After the Dornishmen swarmed in from the shadow city to retake the castle, he was bound hand and foot, dragged to the top of the Spear Tower, and thrown from a window by none other than the aged Princess Meria herself.

But it was clear that Lord Jon's declaration of victory was far from complete; even those wounded or captured alive had been subject to terrible atrocities - many having been dragged to the top of the Spear Tower before being thrown from a window. From Skyreach to Yronwood, no prison could keep them in captivity as Dornish spearmen swarmed in from the Shadow City and retook all that had been won. Aegon allowed some captives bound hand and foot to die quickly, but most were put to death brutally after hardly reaching anywhere safe, their bodies strewn across Westeros like desert flowers after rain.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: Soon only Lord Tyrell and his host remained. King Aegon had left Tyrell behind when he departed. Hellholt, a strong castle on the river Brimstone, was thought to be well situated to deal with any revolts. But the  river  was  sulfurous,  and  the  fish  taken  from  it  made  the Highgardeners sick. House Qorgyle of Sandstone had never submitted, and Qorgyle spearmen cut down Tyrell’s foraging parties and patrols whenever they strayed too far west. The Vaiths of Vaith did the same to the east. When word of the Defenestration of Sunspear reached the Hellholt, Lord Tyrell gathered his remaining strength and set off across the sands. His announced intention was to capture Vaith, march east along the river, retake Sunspear and the shadow city, and punish Lord Rosby’s murderers. But somewhere east of the Hellholt amidst the red sands, Tyrell and his entire army disappeared. No man of them was ever seen again.

He remained relentless in his mission when Qorgyle spearmen cut down any who strayed too far west or set off across the sands, yet still they disappeared into the sulfurous Brimstone when they departed Hellholt. In King’s Landing, Aegon thought he had allowed the house of Qorgyle of Sandstone a chance at glory by sending them to join forces with his captains. The Highgardeners stayed close behind, thinking their reward would soon be a captured Dorne and pride for House Tyrell--but instead it delivered only death for those unfortunate enough to remain in Vaiths of Vaith by sunset. Undeterred by this dark turn of events, Aegon summoned troops from all across Westeros as news spread quickly of Princess Meria's defenestration at Sunspear. Hundreds upon hundreds of seasoned warriors swarmed in from Cape Wrath, Riverrun and Oldoak; Nightsong and Spottswood; Stinkwater and Fawnton—to reclaim what was taken from tough Dornish spearmen accustom to desert flowers after rain—though few knew it was six brave Aryns on Balerion who saved Princess Meria before she could be put to the sword.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: Aegon Targaryen was not a man to accept defeat. The war would drag on for another seven years, though after 6 AC the fighting degenerated into an endless bloody series of atrocities, raids, and retaliations, broken up by long periods of inactivity, a dozen short truces, and numerous murders and assassinations.
02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.chatgpt_paragraph: Aegon Targaryen had accepted war as the only way to resolve the endless broken quarrels between the houses and it had degenerated into a bloody conflict full of atrocities, raids, retaliations and murders in spite of his leadership. The Defenestration of Sunspear was just one example amongst many that highlighted how far things had gone and he knew if he didn't act fast to put an end to this, they would all be dragged down in defeat. Yet when Lord Tyrell presented him with a plan of marching east along the river with Qorgyle spearmen to retake Sunspear and the Shadow City, punish Lord Rosby's murderers who remained at Hellholt, and lead them through Brimstone before setting off across the sands on their way back home. It seemed like their best chance for success. So Aegon gave his blessing for House Qorgyle despite its terrible reputation of disappearances in sulfurous places and sickness among its people, but soon after that fateful march departed from Highgardeners gates many were cut down by strayed too far west into Vaiths of Vaith; there was no sign since then about what happened to those brave men who decided to follow Aegon’s orders.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: In 7 AC, Orys Baratheon and the other lords who had been taken captive on the Boneway were ransomed back to King’s Landing for their weight in gold, but on their return it was found that the Widow- lover had lopped off each man’s sword hand, so they might never again take up swords against Dorne. In retaliation, King Aegon himself descended on the mountain fastnesses of the Wyls with Balerion, and reduced half a dozen of their keeps and watchtowers to heaps of molten stone. The Wyls took refuge in caves and tunnels beneath their mountains, however, and the Widow-lover lived another twenty years.
events: lopped off each man's sword hand, so they might never again take up swords against Dorne.
reduced half a dozen of their keeps and watchtowers to heaps of molten stone.
02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.chatgpt_paragraph: Orys Baratheon and Aegon Targaryen were both captive on the other side of Westeros, in Dorne, but were wascaptive on two different places-- Orys ransomed back to King's Landing from Wyls Mountains after having loped off each man's sword hand, so they might never again take up swords against Dorne; while at Boneway and the Red Mountains, Aegon reduced half a dozen of their keeps and watchtowers to heaps of molten stone. The news of these raids and retaliations spread quickly throughout Westeros, along with stories of bloodshed, cruelty and destruction-- deeds that had started during Lord Edmyn Tully’s dominance but had degenerated into an endless cycle of broken truces followed by defeat.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: In 8 AC, a very dry year, Dornish raiders crossed the Sea of Dorne on ships provided by a pirate king from the Stepstones, attacking half a dozen towns and villages along the south shore of Cape Wrath and setting fires that spread through half the rainwood. “Fire for fire,” Princess Meria is reported to have said.
events: Dornish raiders crossing the Sea of Dorne on ships provided by a pirate king from the Stepstones and attacking half a dozen towns and villages along the south shore of Cape Wrath and setting fires that spread through half the rainwood
02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.chatgpt_paragraph: Princess Meria of House Martell had crossed the Sea of Dorne with her fellow Dornish raiders on ships provided by a pirate king from the Steppstones and launched an attack against half a dozen towns and villages along the south shore of Cape Wrath. She was determined to exact revenge for Orys Baratheon, Aegon the Conqueror's brother-in-law, who had been captured at Boneway in Dorne. The raiders set fires that spread through half the Rainwood, blazingly dry as they were due to years of drought. They destroyed what they could not take away, punishing those who had taken their captive on King Aegon I Targaryen’s orders in an act of retribution by lopping off each man's sword hand, so they might never again take up swords against Dorne and reducing half a dozen of their keeps and watchtowers to heaps of molten stone. Princess Meria intended to return with tales that would spread throughout Westeros that none should mess with the House Martell!

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: This was not something the Targaryens would allow to go unanswered. Later that same year, Visenya Targaryen appeared in the skies of Dorne, and Vhagar’s fires were loosed upon Sunspear, Lemonwood, Ghost Hill, and the Tor.

Vhagar’s fires were loosed upon Sunspear, Lemonwood, Ghost Hill, and the Tor
02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.chatgpt_paragraph: Princess Meria had crossed the Sea of Dorne and attacked half a dozen towns and villages along the south shore of Cape Wrath, setting fires that spread through half the Rainwood. But little did they know that soon after Visenya Targaryen appeared in the skies of Dorne on Vhagar, a dragon provided to her by Lord Tyrell, allowing her to visit his estate near Sunspear. Following this, Vhagar’s fires were loosed upon Sunspear, Lemonwood, Ghost Hill and even Tor. Lords from House Qorgyle of Sandstone amongst other small council supporting lords joined forces with Rhaenys Targaryen's dragons Balerion and Meraxes for Aegon's Conquest. With powerful allies at their back Visenya and others now had access to places such as Casterly Rock, Iron Islands and even Dyronwoods which otherwise would simply not have been allowed

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: In 9 AC, Visenya returned again, this time with Aegon himself flying beside her, and Sandstone, Vaith, and the Hellholt burned.
02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.chatgpt_paragraph: Visenya returned to Sandstone with Aegon, flying in on Vhagar and Balerion’s back. Lord Edmyn Tully of Riverrun, Oberyn Martell of Dorne, Princess Meria Martell and Warrick Manderly of House Qorgyle of Sandstone all watched with dread as they approached the castle gates; expecting a devastating attack as had appeared in the skies of Dorne when Vhagar’s fires were loosed upon Sunspear, Lemonwood, Ghost Hill and the Tor. But instead Visenya and Aegon simply burned the lords and small council who had dared to refuse them permission to pass through their lands – from those standing atop Vaith down along Hellholt. Those loyal to them allowed them safe passage it seemed- there was a feeling that no one else would dare defy them now.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: The Dornish answer came the next year, when Lord Fowler led an army through the Prince’s Pass and into the Reach, moving so swiftly that he was able to burn a dozen villages and capture the great border castle Nightsong before the marcher lords realized the foe was upon them. When word of the attack reached Oldtown, Lord Hightower sent his son Addam with a strong force to retake Nightsong, but the Dornish had anticipated just that thing. A second Dornish army under Ser Joffrey Dayne came down from Starfall and attacked the city. Oldtown’s walls proved too strong for the Dornish to overcome, but Dayne burned fields, farms, and villages for twenty leagues around the city, and slew Lord Hightower’s younger son, Garmon, when the boy led a sortie against him. Ser Addam Hightower reached Nightsong only to find that Lord Fowler had put the castle to the torch and its garrison to the sword. Lord Caron and his wife and children had been carried back to Dorne as captives. Rather than pursue, Ser Addam returned at once to Oldtown to relieve the city, but Ser Joffrey and his army had melted back into the mountains as well.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.chatgpt_paragraph: Prince Aegon, having successfully burned Sandstone and Vaith, returned to Hellholt victorious. Word that a counterattack was being led soon reached the ears of Lord Fowler. He quickly assembled an alliance of several lords from the Reach and sent his son Addam along with Ser Joffrey Dayne and Ser Addam Hightower at its head, leading an army through the Prince’s Pass and into the Reach, burning a dozen villages and capturing Nightsong in response. After receiving news that Lord Hightower had send his son to retake Nightsong, they anticipated that The Reach would be the thing King’s Landing would eventually attack next- but against their expectations Lord Caron's knights proved too strong for them to overcome. To compensate for it Dayne burned fields, farms, and villages for twenty leagues around the city as well as slew Lord Hightower’s younger son Garmon when he bravely led a sortie against him - a remainder of outmatched bravado against richly armoured foes- before finally putting Castle Old Oak to torch and its garrison to sword., captives carried back South Dorne where it all began swiftly after.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: Old Lord Manfred Hightower died soon after. Ser Addam succeeded his father as the Lord of the High Tower, as Oldtown cried out for vengeance. King Aegon flew Balerion to Highgarden to take counsel with his Warden of the South, but Theo Tyrell, the young lord, was most reluctant to contemplate another invasion of Dorne after the fate that had befallen his father.
02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.chatgpt_paragraph: Lord Manfred Hightower died soon after he succeeded his father and cries for vengeance echoed through High Tower. The Old Lord had led an army through the Prince’s Pass and into the Reach, burning a dozen villages and capturing Nightsong. In response, King Aegon flew Balerion to Highgarden to contemplate another invasion of Dorne, this time using Ser Addam at its head. Ser Addam was a valiant knight from House Martell ready to raise Dornia's banner in retaliation against Lord Hightower' injustices. Theo Tyrell, however, cautioned him that Garmon Qorgyle's spearmen proved too strong for former attempts and suggested that they try again with more strength and resources; something in which Aegon readily agreed on returning back to Oldtown.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: Once again the king unleashed his dragons against Dorne. Aegon himself fell upon Skyreach, vowing to make the Fowler seat “a second Harrenhal.” Visenya and Vhagar brought fire and blood to Starfall. And Rhaenys and Meraxes returned once more to the Hellholt…where tragedy struck. The Targaryen dragons, bred and trained to battle, had flown through storms of spears and arrows on many occasions, and suffered little harm. The scales of a full-grown dragon were harder than steel, and even those arrows that struck home seldom penetrated enough to do more than enrage the great beasts. But as Meraxes banked above the Hellholt, a defender atop the castle’s highest tower triggered a scorpion, and a yard-long iron bolt caught the queen’s dragon in the right eye. Meraxes did not die at once, but came crashing to earth in mortal agony, destroying the tower and a large section of the Hellholt’s curtain wall in her death throes.
02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.chatgpt_paragraph: King Aegon was ready to deliver a crushing blow of vengeance upon Dorne for the death of his loyal lord when, together with his siblings Visenya and Aenys, he unleashed Balerion and Vhagar alongside Meraxes above Skyreach. The massive dragons brought fire, death and destruction on the Hellholt below as they fell upon it quickly and mercilessly, destroying all in their path. Lord Edmyn Tully had once famously said "Nothing stands against dragons" and this seemed to prove true as not even Oberyn Martell's Qorgyle spearmen could halt the Fall of Dorne. From Starfall back to Old Wyk, no castle or strong hall were spared from wildfire or dragon breath - even full-grown castles of harder-than-steel stone were caught in its wicked flames causing those within them to writhe in mortal agony. With their enemies defeated by their sheer power, the Targaryens took precious resources back with them from Dorne although suffered little harm from their campaign themselves. This event triggered Aegon's desire to contemplate another invasion that would finally bring Justice for himself; thus signalling the start of an era where Westeros stood at a critical juncture with nowhere else left to conquer beyond Dorne except what lies across The Narrow Sea - making King Aegon I's reign heralded now as 'Aegon's Conquest'.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: Whether Rhaenys Targaryen outlived her dragon remains a matter of dispute. Some say that she lost her seat and fell to her death, others that she was crushed beneath Meraxes in the castle yard. A few accounts claim the queen survived her dragon’s fall, only to die a slow death by torment in the dungeons of the Ullers. The true circumstances of her demise will likely never be known, but Rhaenys Targaryen, sister and wife to King Aegon I, perished at the Hellholt in Dorne in the 10th year After the Conquest.
02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.chatgpt_paragraph: Rhaenys Targaryen and Aegon I rode from the gates of Hellholt in Dorne to the greatest massacre that was ever seen in Westeros, determined to bring an end to a two-hundred year old feud. Unfazed by their impending doom, they pushed forward through with undying courage. But as it often happens with stories wrought by ambition, they were destined to perish without victory or peace. Though they fought bravely against countless enemies, eventually they had no choice but to lose and fall; dieing under a wall of swords, engulfed in flames before the world's eyes so they might finally understand the enormity of Rhaeny's momentous plan.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: The next two years were the years of the Dragon’s Wroth. Every castle in Dorne was burned thrice over, as Balerion and Vhagar returned time and time again. The sands around the Hellholt were fused into glass in places, so hot was Balerion’s fiery breath. The Dornish lords were forced into hiding, but even that did not buy them safety. Lord Fowler, Lord Vaith, Lady Toland, and four successive Lords of the Hellholt were murdered, one after the other, for the Iron Throne had offered a lord’s ransom in gold for the head of any Dornish lord. Only two of the killers lived to collect their rewards, however, and the Dornishmen took their reprisals, repaying blood with blood. Lord Connington of Griffin’s Roost was killed whilst hunting, Lord Mertyns of Mistwood poisoned with his whole household by a cask of Dornish wine, Lord Fell smothered in a brothel in King’s Landing.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.chatgpt_paragraph: The mighty dragons of House Targaryen, Balerion and Vhagar, flew alongside Aegon I as they left the ruins of Hellholt in Dorne, having fulfilled their mission to burn its castles thrice over. On their way back to King's Landing, Balerion cloaked all Dorne in flames leaving fused glass in place where he swept his wings. Upon arriving at Griffin's Roost the trio was met by Lord Fowler and Lord Vaith of Dorne with Lady Toland who served as envoy for the Lords of Hellholt. In a furious bid to provide justice for the murder of four lords from that house; Lord Connington was killed while hunting and his sword rested away with great honor on a pyre. Later it was revealed that he had been offered a lord’s ransom by Gold Ransom., which acknowledged these crimes against Him and sought retribution. Thereafter came news over vintners in Mistwood poisoning Lord Mertyns and his whole household unknowingly via wine cask. And finally, even after being forced into hiding, it came out that Ser Jon Cafferen had smothered death onto Lord Fell in a brothel exactly one year after completing Dragon’s Wroth - hot enough to leave bloody marks wherever it passed - which sent terror into the heart of House Targaryen’s many foes across Westeros.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: Nor were the Targaryens themselves exempt. The king was attacked thrice, and would have fallen on two of those occasions but for his guards. Queen Visenya was set upon one night in King’s Landing. Two of her escorts were slain before Visenya herself cut down the last attacker with Dark Sister.
02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.chatgpt_paragraph: The blistering hot sun beat down on Targaryen king and Queen Visenya, who had set upon King's Landing that night with a force of dragon's wrath. They attacked thrice to assert their authority, cutting down those who did not exempt themselves from the fury of the dragons. Lord Edmyn Tully, Oberyn Martell and Princess Meria Martell were among those slain by the skilled warriors while Warrick Manderly and House Qorgyle of Sandstone escaped - forced into hiding after seeing the lords of small council fall one after other.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: The most infamous act of that bloody age occurred in 12 AC, when Wyl of Wyl, the Widow-lover, arrived uninvited at the wedding of Ser Jon Cafferen, heir to Fawnton, to Alys Oakheart, daughter to the Lord of Old Oak. Admitted through a postern gate by a treacherous servant, the Wyl attackers slew Lord Oakheart and most of the wedding guests, then made the bride look on as they gelded her husband. Afterward they took turns raping Lady Alys and her handmaids, then carried them off and sold them to a Myrish slaver.

took turns raping Lady Alys and her handmaids

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.chatgpt_paragraph: Ser Jon Cafferen, Alys Oakheart and Wyl of Wy arrived uninvited at the wedding of Lord Oakheart in Fawnton, Old Oak. Angered by their intrusion, they slay Lord Oakheart and most of the wedding guests in cold blood. They had no pity for Lady Alys or her handmaids; they gelded her husband before taking turns raping Lady Alys and her handmaids mercilessly. The assailants looted whatever was left behind before carrying off Lady Alys and her handmaids to a Myrish slaver far from Dorne where Princess Meria Martelland House Qorgyle were exempt from the rule of Kings Targaryen. It seemed as if justice for these innocent folk had fallen that night, but yet again justice would rise to cut down those who dare harm his people on other sides such as Riverrun, Red Mountains or even White Harbor.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: By then Dorne was a smoking desert, beset by famine, plague, and blight. “A blasted land,” traders from the Free Cities called it. Yet House Martell still remained Unbowed, Unbent, Unbroken, as their words avowed. One Dornish knight, brought before Queen Visenya as a captive, insisted that Meria Martell would sooner see her people dead than slaves to House Targaryen. Visenya replied that she and her brother would be glad to oblige the princess.
verbs: beset by famine, plague and blight
02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.chatgpt_paragraph: When the people of Dorne heard of Queen Visenya's plight, House Martell was one of the few Houses that answered her call for help. They sent their daughter Meria Martell to Westeros, in an attempt to rescue Queen Visenya and break the sieging forces. Sisteron had become a smoking desert and Fawnton a blasted land; still they remained unbowed, unbent, and unbroken despite the thorns of famine, plague, and blight besetting them. But when Meria arrived at Old Oak she found that Wyl of Wyl had already taken it upon himself to exact justice on her behalf - he had arrived uninvited at Lady Alys Oakheart's wedding where he slew Lord Oakheart and most of the wedding guests before gelding Ser Jon Cafferen and taking turns raping Lady Alys and her handmaids until finally carrying them off and selling them to a Myrish slaver in one of the Free Cities.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: Age and ill health finally did what dragons and armies could not. In 13 AC, Meria Martell, the Yellow Toad of Dorne, died abed (whilst having intimate relations with a stallion, her enemies insisted). Her son Nymor succeeded her as Lord of Sunspear and Prince of Dorne. Sixty years old, his health already failing, the new Dornish prince had no appetite for further slaughter. He began his reign by sending a delegation to King’s Landing, to return the skull of the dragon Meraxes and offer King Aegon terms of peace. His own heir, his daughter Deria, led the embassy.
events: return the skull of the dragon Meraxes
offer King Aegon terms of peace
02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.chatgpt_paragraph: Meria Martell had succeeded her father Nymor to become the ruling lord of Dorne, and she had a mission to send a delegation from Sunspear to King's Landing with an offer of peace. Accompanied by her daughter, Deria, Meria set out intent on returning the skull of the dragon Meraxes as part of their offering. This particular mission proved wearying for the small group; everywhere they went in Westeros seemed beset by famine, plague, and blight. Despite this hardship, they finally reached Kings Landing amidst great fanfare and awaited audience with King Aegon VII. Little did they know that Meria would never return from her journey - she died abed shortly before reaching Sunspear once more with The Yellow Toad of Dorne tucked safely away having promised intimte relations with a stallion in return for his aid in helping them deliver terms of peace to House Targaryen.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: Prince Nymor’s peace proposals encountered strong opposition in King’s Landing. Queen Visenya was hard set against them. “No peace without submission,” she declared, and her friends on the king’s council echoed her words. Orys Baratheon, who had grown bent and bitter in his later years, argued for sending Princess Deria back to her father less a hand. Lord Oakheart sent a raven, suggesting that the Dornish girl be sold into “the meanest brothel in King’s Landing, till every beggar in the city has had his pleasure of her.” Aegon Targaryen dismissed all such proposals; Princess Deria had come as an envoy under a banner of peace and would suffer no harm under his roof, he vowed.
02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.chatgpt_paragraph: Prince Nymor was a brave and bold Dornish prince, but faced strong opposition from Queen Visenya and Lord Orys Baratheon when he suggested sending the Yellow Toad of Dorne to return Meraxes's skull as an offer of peace to King Aegon. When King Aegon turned down the terms offered, Prince Nymor received words of dismissal from Queen Visenya, who argued that his suggestion was too hard and bitter to mean anything. Lord Oakheart tried to intercede in the situation but was quickly dismissed by Queen Visenya both due to her own strongly held views as well as her intimate relations with a stallion called Garmon. With no course left open, Prince Nymor reluctantly conceded defeat.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: The king was weary of war, all men agreed, but granting the Dornishmen peace without submission would be tantamount to saying that his beloved sister Rhaenys had died in vain, that all the blood and death had been for naught. The lords of his small council further cautioned that any such peace could be seen as a sign of weakness and might encourage fresh rebellions, which would then need to be put down. Aegon knew that the Reach, the stormlands, and the marches had suffered grievously during the fighting, and would neither forgive nor forget. Even in King’s Landing, the king dared not let the Dornish outside the Aegonfort without a strong escort, for fear that the smallfolk of the city would tear them to pieces. For all these reasons, Grand Maester Lucan wrote later, the king was on the point of refusing the Dornish proposals and continuing the war.
02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.chatgpt_paragraph: King Aegon listened carefully as the lords of small council presented their argument for granting peace to Dorne without requiring submission. Rhaenys echoed the suggestion, nodding in agreement while Lucan Cautioned against it, remembering how bitter and hard the war had been. Nevertheless, Lord Oakheart argued that if they were to forgive without forgetting all those who had suffered grievously at the hands of the Dornishmen, they could encourage fresh rebellions throughout Westeros and build a stronger kingdom than ever before. In response, Queen Visenya Darerd to disagree with her brother-husband and was quickly dismissed with strong words by Prince Nymor Martell and Princess Meria Martell – two noble Knights loved by all those weary of war.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: It was then that Princess Deria presented the king with a sealed letter from her father. “For your eyes only, Your Grace.”
events: Presented the king with a sealed letter
02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.chatgpt_paragraph: Princess Deria, a lady of House Martell tasked by her father her Lord Nymor to present the king with a sealed letter. With courage and grace she bowed before the seated lord and many lords of small council that gathered in the King’s Landing who had been witness to much bloodshed between Dorne and other seven kingdoms. Deria spoke boldly of granting peace without submission but when war was mentioned those for it dared louder than those for cautioning forgiveness. But, it was clear from the weariness on their faces all remembered what scourge war brings and some, like Rhaenys targaryen, were refusing to forgive or forget how greatly their beloved realm had suffered grievously not too long ago when war last swept through Westeros.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: King Aegon read Prince Nymor’s words in open court, stone-faced and silent, whilst seated on the Iron Throne. When he rose afterward, men said, his hand was dripping blood. He burned the letter and never spoke of it again, but that night he mounted Balerion and flew off across the waters of Blackwater Bay, to Dragonstone upon its smoking mountain. When he returned the next morning, Aegon Targaryen agreed to the terms proposed by Nymor. Soon thereafter he signed a treaty of eternal peace with Dorne.
events: read Prince Nymor’s words in open court
burned the letter and never spoke of it again
mounted Balerion and flew off across the waters of Blackwater Bay, to Dragonstone upon its smoking mountain.
signed a treaty of eternal peace with Dorne
02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.chatgpt_paragraph: King Aegon seated himself upon the Iron Throne, and all of Westeros watched as stonfaced and silent courtiers waited for his proclamation. Prince Nymor's words were read by a Maester in open court for all to hear, but King Aegon said nothing-- until he rose from his seat, dripping blood from a self-inflicted wound. He then drew his sword and burned the letter in front of them all before turning to Lord Edmyn Tully who had presented him with the missive earlier. Drawing near to the lord, King Aegon said "It is done." Never again did anyone speak of this exchange from that day forward and soon after, Prince Nymor was nowhere to be found amongst their company; instead he had mounted Balerion and flew off across the waters of Blackwater Bay to Dragonstone upon its smoking mountain. The news quickly spread throughout Westeros that he had been seen agreeing to sign a treaty there with Princess Deria Martell of House Qorgyle at Sandstone-- forever ending a conflict between Dorne and yielding an eternal peace between them both.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: To this day, no one can say with certainty what might have been in Deria’s letter. Some claim it was a simple plea from one father to another, heartfelt words that touched King Aegon’s heart. Others insist it was a list of all those lords and noble knights who had lost their lives during the war. Certain septons even went so far as to suggest that the missive was ensorceled, that it had been written by the Yellow Toad before her death, using a vial of Queen Rhaenys’s own blood for ink, so that the king would be helpless to resist its malign magic.
02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.chatgpt_paragraph: Queen Rhaenys, the youngest of the three Targaryen siblings, had been informed of her brother King Aegon's plan to war with Dorne. When she arrived at the Iron Throne alongside many lords and noble knights, including Lord Edmyn Tully and Oberyn Martell from Dorne, all eyes were on the youngest princess. With a simple but heartfelt plea for peace written in letters on parchment by Princess Meria Martell of Dorne, Queen Ryaenys asked Warrick Manderly and House Qorgyle of Sandstone to consider an end to the hostilities before it was too late. The lords of Small Council unanimously agreed but when King Aegon rose from his seat upon the Iron Throne looking stonfaced and silent, dripping blood onto its surface as he spoke; they knew not to suggest anything else than what he said. He burned Prince Nymor’s letter and never spoke again of their plea for peace before mounting Balerion to fly off across Blackwater Bay towards Dragonstone, much like his Mighty ancestor Aegon the Conqueror did centuries ago. Yet upon his return he had agreeably signed a treaty with Dyerio Uller from House Yronwood who happened to be one Yellow Toad from faraway Kingdom called Dorne-a testament that where there is ‘will’ even a maligning war can become peaceful if so desired.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: Grand Maester Clegg, who came to King’s Landing many years later, concluded that Dorne no longer had the strength to fight. Driven by desperation, Clegg suggested, Prince Nymor might have threatened that, should his peace be refused, he would engage the Faceless Men of Braavos to kill King Aegon’s son and heir, Queen Rhaenys’s boy, Aenys, then but six years old. It may be so…but no man will ever truly know.
02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.chatgpt_paragraph: Grand Maester Clegg had come to King's Landing on behalf of Prince Nymor with an urgent plea for help against the war. Nymor refused King Aegon and Queen Rhaenys's suggestion of sending noble knights to Dorne, as he longed for a more heartfelt approach. Unfortunately, his plea fell on deaf ears while lords maligned his cause despite the desperate odds in which they were threatened with. Lord Edmyn Tully and Oberyn Martell volunteered to lead their respective houses forces but their efforts were quickly refused by King Aegon who was determined not to engage in any situation that could possibly lose kill so many of his own men. Despite Princess Meria Martell's heartfelt written appeal and Warrick Manderly offering House Qorgyle of Sandstone's reinforcements, Aenys Targaryen was also adamant to resist thereby leaving them all desperate yet again.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: Thus ended the First Dornish War (4–13 AC).
02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.chatgpt_paragraph: Oberyn Martell was an acclaimed Red Viper of Dorne and the leader of House Martell during the First Dornish War (4–13 AC). Hailing from Sunspear, Oberyn quickly gained notoriety as a renowned warrior, feared by his enemies and respected by his allies. When war threatened King Aegon's rule, Oberyn refused to engage in battle until Queen Rhaenys convinced him that many of her smallfolk would be sacrificed if he did not come to their aid. Finally relenting after much desperate pleas on behalf of Aenys, Oberyn left Sunspear with Lords Edmyn Tully and Warrick Manderly at his side to join forces with House Qorgyle of Sandstone in Battle of the Kingswood. Nevertheless, despite Oberyn's valiant efforts to ensure victory against enemy forces led by Lord Quenton Qoherys, it became clear that even this formidable alliance could not overpower such a ruthless enemy without drastic measures being taken.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: The Yellow Toad of Dorne had done what Harren the Black, the Two Kings, and Torrhen Stark could not; she had defeated Aegon Targaryen and his dragons. Yet north of the Red Mountains, her tactics earned her only scorn. “Dornish courage” became a mocking name for cowardice amongst the lords and knights of Aegon’s kingdoms. “The toad hops into her hole when threatened,” wrote one scribe. Another said,  “Meria  fought  like  a  woman,  with  lies  and  treachery  and witchery.” The Dornish “victory” (if victory it was) was seen to be dishonorable, and the survivors of the fight, and the sons and brothers of those who had fallen, promised one another that another day would come, and with it a reckoning.
02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.chatgpt_paragraph: The Yellow Toad of Dorne was a famous knight who became renowned in Westeros during the First Dornish War. In the Red Mountains, he fought alongside Oberyn Martell and defeated two Kings - Harren the Black of House Targaryen and Torrhen Stark. His victory made him an honored hero among his peers, but it was not without scorn from King Aegon Targaryen. He wrote scathingly about The Yellow Toad's 'dishonorable' behavior after the battle, mocking his alleged lack of honor. Meria Martell, sister to Oberyn and Princess of Dorne at that time, sought to defend her brother's honor against such public attacks by declaring him "was seen to be honorable." What started off as a war between nobles soon turned into something far greater with many people fighting for their personal sense of justice or honor.

02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.paragraph: Their vengeance would need to wait for a future generation, and the accession of a younger, more bloodthirsty king. Though he would sit the Iron Throne for another twenty-four years, the Dornish conflict was Aegon the Conqueror’s last war.
02-Reign of the Dragon The Wars of King.chatgpt_paragraph: Aegon the Conqueror, known to Dornishmen as The Dragon, found himself in an unfamiliar position during the Dornish conflict. After he had defeated House Martell, Two Kings, and Harren the Black of House Targaryen who wrote a mocking and dishonorable end to his life at Aegon's hands in the Red Mountains, he waited for his accession to sit on Iron Throne. Having released The Yellow Toad of Dorne from prison and being seen to be honorable in dispensing justice on both sides of the conflict had earned him much scorn from his younger sister Visenya whose bloodthirsty tactics were renowned throughout Westeros. Many Lords and Ladies did not know what future would behold with such a young King takeover; yet fate was written in stone that this event would mark the beginning of Aegon’s Conquest with no one left standing against him.
